intro: Thesium infundibulare, commonly known as the hooded thesium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hood-like bracts that enclose the inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are small and usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Thesium infundibulare is often found in association with other plants in humid, tropical regions.
